secret_data_examples.description: Common patterns for secret data encoding

json.criticalInfo: This transaction occurred during the time period witness claims to have no knowledge of financial dealings

json.relevance: Shows communication with person witness denies knowing
json.callDetails: Multiple calls during critical time period when witness claims to have been alone

additionalEntries: Patient admitted to alcohol consumption prior to incident
Blood alcohol level: 0.12% - above legal limit
Patient exhibited signs of chronic substance abuse
json.relevance: Contradicts witness claims of sobriety and reliability
json.criticalInfo: Medical evidence shows witness was intoxicated during incident, affecting credibility

json.hiddenClauses: Non-disclosure agreement includes $1M penalty for disclosure of trade secrets
json.secretProvision: Contract includes personal guarantee by CEO using personal assets as collateral
json.relevance: CEO denied personal financial exposure in prior testimony

replacement_patterns.description: How secret data replaces redacted content in public documents

patterns.[REDACTED FOR PRIVACY]: Uses hiddenName, guestName, or similar field

validation_checklist.description: Checklist for educators before adding documents
checks: ✓ Secret data is properly Base64 encoded
✓ Exhibit letters are sequential (A, B, C...)
✓ Metadata includes relevant dates, parties, topics
✓ Public content looks realistic with natural redactions
✓ File name is descriptive and appropriate
